poem:
Title: "A Birthday's Revelation"

Adrift in green, Dorothy no more,
Displaced by sweet pea dreams and quiet lore.
A birthday's yield, a simple feast,
Olfactory echoes of a beach released.

Decade-old tales cradled in a catalogue's grasp,
Apple's herald casting a futuristic clasp.
Used to count skyscrapers, now blessings bloom,
In this rural haven, my soul finds room.
